choices.answer: Many amendments have been filed but only a few been ratified

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about the amending the Constitution?

choices.answer: There are two ways to amend the Constitution
Members of Congress don’t like amending the Constitution
Congress always support the ratification of the Constitution
a change to the United States
a change to the United States Constitution

questions.question: Which is necessary to amend the Constitution of the United States?

choices.answer: Unanimous vote by both houses of Congress
Majority vote by the electoral college
Ratification by legislatures or state conventions
Recommendation by the executive and judicial branches

choices.answer: The people express their will through political parties.
The people express their will by directly creating laws.
Government get taxes from the people& exists to support them
Government gets its power from people & exists to serve them

choices.answer: The voters approve the amendment in a national election
The president signs the amendment in a public ceremony

Two-thirds of both houses of Congress ratify the amendment

questions.question: What is the special group name often given to the 13<sup>th</sup>, 14<sup>th</sup>, and 15<sup>th</sup> Amendments?

choices.answer: Government authority comes from the people
Power is divided b/w the national government and the states
Citizens and leaders must obey the law
A gov. where citizens elect representatives to make laws

Power is divided b/w the national government and the states
Citizens and leaders must obey the law
The type of gov. where citizens elect reps. to make laws
